attributes.action: Reduce subsidies and household expense claims for MP’s paid by the taxpayer
attributes.additional_details: I want to reduce or eliminate the extraordinary subsidies and expenses enjoyed by members of both Houses of Parliament. The vast majority of British people don’t have such subsidising of their everyday life. We are told difficult choices have to be made, and are suffering through high inflation. Parliament should show leadership by making difficult choices for themselves first.
attributes.background: Cease the taxpayer subsidies given to licensed premises in the Palace of Westminster. Cease the everyday household expense claims and subsidies enjoyed by MP’s. Most British people get no such feather bedding in these difficult times.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for expenses for MPs. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government. You can find out more about IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk

The House of Commons Catering service does not provide a subsidised service in the commercial sense of the word. Some venues make a profit, while in other venues the cost of providing the service does exceed the income received in sales due to the irregular hours and unpredictability of parliamentary business. The House of Commons publishes details of the cost of House of Commons catering services: https://www.parliament.uk/site-information/foi/transparency-publications/hoc-transparency-publications/catering-services/transparency-reporting-catering-services/

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Raise prices for House of Commons catering services to enable full cost recovery: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/622377
